word: Oh, if those who believe the truth in England had the spirit of Christ, feeling the peril of souls, what a work would be done wholly in his name! There would be much earnest prayer ascending to God, not merely in public service, not only from the secret chamber, but there would be unceasing prayer combined with determined action.--Letter 31, 1892, pp. 1-3, 5, 6. (To Brother Waggoner, May, 1892.)
